title: Investigate WiFi debug spam in serial output
description: Device is flooding serial output with repetitive WiFi status logs (RSSI readings). Need to find the source in firmware code and determine if this is intentional debug logging or a bug. Goal is to disable/throttle this spam so only meaningful events are logged.
acceptance_criteria: Identify source of repetitive RSSI log messages in firmware
Determine if logging is intentional or unintended
Document findings in task investigation section

verification.test_results: Verified on device - WiFi debug spam completely eliminated. Serial output now clean with only meaningful application logs (LOOP status and WiFi connection info). Bootloader startup garbage is normal ESP32 behavior.
